results.title: We came to an understanding
results.creator_credit: Ros Henning, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ros Henning loves her life of abundance on the farm. She has developed relationships with the sheep, worms and chickens that keep everything running smoothly.

results.title: The Man on the assembly line
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
A dramatized look at a man who ultimately pays the price for the benefits associated with modern mass production - a worker in an automobile factory who performs one operation with relentless monotony so that the assembly line can keep moving at top efficiency.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Morten Parker, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Goods & chattels : the story of Theodor
results.creator_credit: Robert Voigt, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Robert Voigt recounts his rich family history and their connection to their farm in Beechworth. When his father, Henry, purchased more land, he received, as part of the goods and chattels in the contract, Theodor, a farm labourer. Theodor was a man of vast intelligence and mysterious origins.

results.title: The Clerk
results.creator_credit: Allan Wargon, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
This film explores the conflict between what a man (in this case an office clerk) wants from his job and what the company wants from him. It raises the question of how far an industry ought to be expected to go in relieving dull, repetitive work for the sake of employee satisfaction.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Allan Wargon, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Ghost paintings
results.brief_description: An innovative Melbourne artist, James Clayden has worked in theatre, film and painting for more than 30 years. His ‘Ghost Paintings’ series, produced over the past seventeen years, represents a bold and unique synthesis of film and video art. By combining cryptic fragments of dialogue delivered by actors, with highly saturated unfocused images and a disorienting soundscape, he creates an abstracted visual poetry that defies rational analysis, but that nevertheless invokes thought in the viewer. Cast: Helen Hopkins, Tom Wright, Faruk Avdi, Shelley Lasica, Meg White, Thomas Eckersley. Music: Ad Hoc, The Other (Chris Knowles, David Wadelton, David Brown, James Clayden).

results.title: The Full bell curve
results.creator_credit: Paula Pippin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Paula Pippin and her husband told their friends they were moving to the country, the responses ranged from suspicion to outright hostility. But the Pippin family were on an adventure which would introduce them to the full bell curve of society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paula Pippin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Adapt to change or leave the land
results.creator_credit: Tom Carroll, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As Tom Carroll reflects on five generations of his family and their land at Mudgeegonga in northern Victoria. In doing so, he recalls the various challenges his ancestors faced, as well as the changes they needed to accomodate, much in the same way he has to today.

results.title: The Vice President
results.creator_credit: Hugh O'Connor, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
Elevation to the position of Vice-President brings prestige responsibility and freedoms of action, but it also means a shifting of loyalties and the losing of personal contact. This is shown in the dramatised story of John Harvard who rising from Branch Director to Vice-President finds himself having to put pressure on the men who a short time ago were his near equals. Only by going against their wishes can he serve the best interests of his company.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hugh O’Connor, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.description:

results.title: Not without Val
results.creator_credit: Vin Shelly, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vin Shelly has served the Shire of Chiltern for 20 years, and was shire president for three terms. He shares some of his interests over the years, as well as his main source of pride, the family farm.
